page.title: 14Architecture in Exton.
page.content: The 17th cent.Exton Farm is a typical Devon thatch and cob cottage with the unusual(sometimes dangerous to lorries) addition of an extending room over the porch.There are other thatched cottages in Exton.Notable buildings in the village include the pretty,gabled Victorian school,where use was made of wooden shingles for decoration.This is now a business premises. The Puffing Billy Pub is not unusual but is renowned for its Falklands mementos.The former railway station has been converted to a"haute-cuisine" restaurant.Exton is unusual in that there is no church in the village,only a chapel.(see population of Exton)
